title: Somatic Healing
subtitle: The body remembers what the mind forgets
description: Learn to work with trauma, tension, and stuck emotions through the body rather than just the mind. This course teaches practical somatic techniques for releasing what's been held and restoring natural flow.

whatYouLearn: Understand how experience is stored in the body
requirements: Nervous System Mastery course or equivalent understanding
Professional support recommended for significant trauma

questions.question: How does experience get 'stored' in the body?
options: It doesn't - the body just reflects the mind
Through muscle tension, fascial patterns, and nervous system states that persist

questions.question: What is 'pendulation' in somatic work?
options: Moving between activation and calm to build capacity

questions.question: What is 'titration'?
options: Working with small doses of activation rather than flooding

questions.question: Why does chronic tension persist?
options: The nervous system learned to hold as protection and hasn't received signals of safety

questions.question: What does 'completing a survival response' mean?
options: Allowing the body to finish fight/flight/freeze movements that were interrupted

questions.question: Why is slow, gentle work often more effective than intense catharsis?
options: It isn't - intensity is always better
Gentle work keeps the window of tolerance open for actual processing
